intro: Lisianthius brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its narrow, grass-like leaves and clustered inflorescences make it a distinctive species within its genus. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native habitat.
